caption: The Northampton area is a good fit for a day trip. Far enough that you feel like you've gotten “away”, but close enough that you aren’t exhausted by the time you get back home. Also, it’s got a good “feel”. A few months ago, I thought of it mostly as a place where we could be allowed to have a house, but there’s something subtle about it that is refreshing. Of course, that could be the “away” part.
htmlFragment:
• 4/10/2022, 7:51:17 PM
    The Northampton area is a good fit for a day trip. Far enough that you feel like you've gotten “away”, but close enough that you aren’t exhausted by the time you get back home. Also, it’s got a good “feel”. A few months ago, I thought of it mostly as a place where we could be allowed to have a house, but there’s something subtle about it that is refreshing. Of course, that could be the “away” part.

caption: Way back in February, the guy and I filled a container with snow, mud, and leaves from outside in an attempt to capture the typical strata on the ground, then observed how it melted. This was inspired by seeing cool little streams form in the surface of the ice outside. Our time lapse turned out less interesting than that, but since we tied up the bathtub for 24 hours for it, I might as well at least post it.
htmlFragment:
• 4/11/2022, 6:59:34 AM
    Way back in February, the guy and I filled a container with snow, mud, and leaves from outside in an attempt to capture the typical strata on the ground, then observed how it melted. This was inspired by seeing cool little streams form in the surface of the ice outside. Our time lapse turned out less interesting than that, but since we tied up the bathtub for 24 hours for it, I might as well at least post it.

caption: The rare literal backstab.
htmlFragment:
• 4/11/2022, 11:29:51 AM
    The rare literal backstab.

caption:
Etsy sellers strike.
Etsy made bank over the pandemic. In 2020, they more than doubled their gross marketplace sales. In 2021, they kept those pandemic sales gains and broke their 2020 record by $3.2 billion dollars.

In June of 2021, they acquired Elo7, the “Etsy of Brazil” to the tune of $217 million dollars cash.
In July of 2021, they completed acquisition of Depop, a British fashion marketplace, to the tune of $1.625 billion dollars, primarily cash.

They followed up these record pandemic gains by turning around and sticking it to their sellers.

On April 11, 2022, they plan to increase our transaction fees by 30%.
Yet another company that has a reputation of being rainbows and joy and employees with colored hair, that is, in fact, a corporation.
htmlFragment:
• 4/11/2022, 12:11:23 PM
    Etsy sellers strike.
    Etsy made bank over the pandemic. In 2020, they more than doubled their gross marketplace sales. In 2021, they kept those pandemic sales gains and broke their 2020 record by $3.2 billion dollars.

    In June of 2021, they acquired Elo7, the “Etsy of Brazil” to the tune of $217 million dollars cash.
    In July of 2021, they completed acquisition of Depop, a British fashion marketplace, to the tune of $1.625 billion dollars, primarily cash.

    They followed up these record pandemic gains by turning around and sticking it to their sellers.

    On April 11, 2022, they plan to increase our transaction fees by 30%.
    Yet another company that has a reputation of being rainbows and joy and employees with colored hair, that is, in fact, a corporation.

caption:
- Took ACs out to curb, posted to Craigslist about them, scheduled a pickup from the city as backup. But six people emailed me, and someone took them before I could mark them as being for someone that emailed me.
- Called about a health insurance thing that was actually totally my fuckup. (I missed a deadline.) They were actually helpful and forgiving, and hopefully, we will not have to find new health insurance.
- Client B work.
- Took four bags of clothes and a box of uncontroversial board games to Goodwill. Also, possibly a friend's puzzle, so I'll have to go look for that tomorrow!
- Took the guy to social class. Helped with homework, though he did not appreciate hearing that something had to be redone.
- Emailed a former colleague.
- Went to electronic music group. Worked on Flooding some more and got in more tempo variability and envelopes so there aren't as many popping noises. We kinda got off-topic and started talking about Joseph's cool California E. coli map.

There were more things I wanted to fit in, and I felt defeated, but then I reflected, and I think the things that happened were actually pretty good today.
htmlFragment:
• 4/11/2022, 10:01:53 PM

    - Called about a health insurance thing that was actually totally my fuckup. (I missed a deadline.) They were actually helpful and forgiving, and hopefully, we will not have to find new health insurance.
    - Client B work.
    - Took four bags of clothes and a box of uncontroversial board games to Goodwill. Also, possibly a friend's puzzle, so I'll have to go look for that tomorrow!
    - Took the guy to social class. Helped with homework, though he did not appreciate hearing that something had to be redone.
    - Emailed a former colleague.
    - Went to electronic music group. Worked on Flooding some more and got in more tempo variability and envelopes so there aren't as many popping noises. We kinda got off-topic and started talking about Joseph's cool California E. coli map.

    There were more things I wanted to fit in, and I felt defeated, but then I reflected, and I think the things that happened were actually pretty good today.

caption:
- A little bit of Client B work.
- Packed up board games; figured out which ones to give away. This was really tiring and stressful for some reason? I just felt like doing a million things like this will take forever, but we've actually made decent progress, especially Katt.
- Had a conference with the guy's teacher. It's sort of heartbreaking that he doesn't seem to be making friends and is content to be an observer. But he's a fairly happy guy still? This is all in line with his behavioral health eval, which gave a diagnosis but didn't really have any solutions other than "keep trying what you're trying." Academically, she said he's very strong, though, and his task initiation is getting better.
- Client C work. Landed a minor victory here!
- Real estate agent communication.
- Met with a painter/handyman. Got really good advice about minor defects but also a really high painting estimate. Gotta shop around, sadly.
- Did some town research, found out about some disappointing/scary racist incidents.
- Made dinner.
- Took down a shelf and a wall-mounted desk.

Well, I woke up at 4 this morning with general anxiety and didn't quite get back to sleep, so I'm wiped again. I feel content now, though!
htmlFragment:

    - Had a conference with the guy's teacher. It's sort of heartbreaking that he doesn't seem to be making friends and is content to be an observer. But he's a fairly happy guy still? This is all in line with his behavioral health eval, which gave a diagnosis but didn't really have any solutions other than "keep trying what you're trying." Academically, she said he's very strong, though, and his task initiation is getting better.
    - Client C work. Landed a minor victory here!
    - Real estate agent communication.
    - Met with a painter/handyman. Got really good advice about minor defects but also a really high painting estimate. Gotta shop around, sadly.
    - Did some town research, found out about some disappointing/scary racist incidents.
    - Made dinner.
    - Took down a shelf and a wall-mounted desk.

    Well, I woke up at 4 this morning with general anxiety and didn't quite get back to sleep, so I'm wiped again. I feel content now, though!

caption:
Eight-minute run, 14 pull-ups. This lovely person was yelling at people who came through the tunnel and trying to block their passage. Very tactical positioning!

He told me to “go over there with my phone and video,” which I guess I kinda did. Someone else called the cops.

caption: I am far from being the only one to call it, but I knew that Elon Musk would try to take over Twitter when he backed away from the standstill agreement he was offered in exchange for a spot on the board. Twitter kind of deserves this; I have no idea how an employee could serve that company after so many atrocities. But the world doesn't deserve a dominant platform directed by a right-wing plutocrat.
htmlFragment:
• 4/14/2022, 12:12:31 PM

Twitter kind of deserves this; I have no idea how an employee could serve that company after so many atrocities. But the world doesn't deserve a dominant platform directed by a right-wing plutocrat.
